title: Will it be possible to include financial education in school curriculum? - Quora

response.answer_text: School curricula are aimed to provide, "transferrable skills." These include mathematics, languages, especially English, science, history and geography. Useful additional subjects would include philosophy, logic, economics, politics and possibly law. To agree suitable curricula for these subjects would be contentious but they would be a useful addition. Alternative language teaching is woefully inadequate and needs to be introduced into primary schools while children still have the inate ability to learn language. You have to remember that school is compulsory. School is both a priviledge and a prison sentence. What do society, government, parents and children require from school? Why subject children to it? Ideals Give children a wider outlook on life and experience. Equip them with the knowledge and understanding to deal with with all the challenges and opportunities they might meet in their lives. Form well rounded citizens that contribute to society. Practical possibilites Have knowledge and understanding to get and keep a job. Maintain the countries economy. Some additional skills and understanding. Minimum Requirements Reading, Ryeting and 'Rithmetic. Keep them off the streets.
